text: a lot of people wonder what Einstein
meant by his equation e equals
mc-squared it's not as hard as you would
think the C squared is just a number
it's a big number
think of a conversion rate between safe
centigrade and Fahrenheit or between
pounds and dollars you have two
different things and there's a
conversion rate so C squared is simply a
number telling you how much mass turns
into how much energy C is the speed of
light which is really big C squared is
even bigger it's a humongous number so
what the equation says is that if you
take a little bit of mass tiny bit of
mass a chair for example and turn it
into pure energy that little bit of mass
gets multiplied by the huge number a
single chair the stool that I'm sitting
on as we speak if it was turned into
energy would not only destroy New York
City but most of Greater New York State
would no longer be there with the ocean
pouring in all that is hidden inside
mass and before Einstein realized that
in 1905 when he was 26 nobody had any
idea it was there
